name: Mixed Bag 35 Quiz / Test | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [B] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote 'The House Of the Seven Gables?
questions.explanation:
Nathaniel Hawthorne.

	Other noted works of his were 'The Scarlet Letter' and 'Twice Told Tales'.

Elia Kazan.

	This 1954 classic starred Marlon Brando, Karl Malden, Lee J. Cobb, Rod Steiger and Eva Marie Saint among others.

questions.text: What kind of clothing is a mackintosh?
questions.explanation:
Raincoat.

	It is defined as a waterproof overgarment.

questions.text: Ray Noble was the bandleader for which ventriloquist?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Bergen.

	His band also played fot the 'Burns and Allen' radio show.

questions.text: In a fictional storytale what kind of animal was 'Bongo'?
questions.explanation:
Circus bear.

	As an aside there is also an animal in real life called a bongo. It is a large antelope related to the eland.

questions.text: Skier Jean Claude Killy is from what country?
questions.explanation:
France.

	He was born August 30th 1943. He won 3 gold medals in the 1968 Olympics.

questions.text: In literature who created Puddinghead Wilson?
questions.explanation:
Mark Twain.

	Born in Missouri, his more famous works include 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer', 'The Prince and the Pauper' and 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn'.

France.

	In 1934 Henri Pigozzi founded Simca at Nanterre, near Paris in France.

questions.text: In what century was the piano invented?
Magellan sailed on behalf of what country?
questions.explanation:
Spain.

	He was born in Portugal but renounced his Portuguese citzenship and in 1517 went to Spain.
